snippet: Stockton’s City Council decided to begin mediation in a last-ditch effort to avoid having the city become the nation’s largest to declare bankruptcy.
abstract: City of Stockton, California, facing an enormous budget deficit, is making a last-ditch attempt to negotiate with unions and creditors in order to avoid bankruptcy; Stockton is the first city to adhere to a California law requiring cities to hire a third-party mediator to help in negotiations for a period of 90 days before bankruptcy can be declared.

byline.contributor: Malia Wollan contributed reporting from Stockton, and Mary Williams Walsh from New York.

lead_paragraph: Stockton’s City Council decided to begin mediation in a last-ditch effort to avoid having the city become the nation’s largest to declare bankruptcy.

headline.seo: Stockton, Calif., Moves Closer to Bankruptcy
headline.main: In California, City Teeters on Brink of Bankruptcy
headline.print_headline: In California, City Teeters On Brink of Bankruptcy
